meanings.definition: Relating to or situated around an axis.
meanings.sent1: The Earth's rotation causes axial tilt.
meanings.sent2: The axial line runs straight through the center of the object.
meanings.sent3: The axial squirrel balanced on the tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: His life took an axial turn after the big promotion.
meanings.sent5: The axial mountain stood tall and proud in the landscape.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or forming an axis.
meanings.sent1: The axial symmetry of the design made it visually appealing.
meanings.sent2: The axial point marked the center of the circle.
meanings.sent3: The axial cake was perfectly sliced into equal parts.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was the axial bond that held the group together.
meanings.sent5: The axial ruler measured the length accurately.

meanings.definition: Involving or relating to an axis.
meanings.sent1: The axial movement of the machine was smooth and precise.
meanings.sent2: The axial shift caused changes in the system.
meanings.sent3: The axial dance routine impressed the audience.
meanings.sent4: Their conversation took an axial turn towards deeper topics.
meanings.sent5: The axial force kept the structure stable.
